column2: Aetna CEO says not time to give up on health insurance exchangesAetna CEO says he is not giving up on public insurance exchanges Jan 12 The chief executive of Aetna Inc  on Tuesday said the health insurer is not about to withdraw from the public health exchange market
column3: even after losing money on the business last year.  Aetna CEO says he is not giving up on public insurance exchanges Jan 12 The chief executive of Aetna Inc  on Tuesday said the health insurer is not about to withdraw from the public health exchange market
column4: even after losing money on the business last year. Jan 12 AETNA CEO MARK BERTOLINI SAYS IT'S NOT TIME TO GIVE UP ON PUBLIC HEALTH INSURANCE EXCHANGES AETNA CEO SAYS IMPORTANT TO INSURE ALL AMERICANS AETNA CEO SAYS IT'S IMPORTANT TO MAKE RETAIL MARKET WORK IN HEALTHCARE   (Reporting by Susan Kelly in Chicago)Aetna CEO says he is not giving up on public insurance exchanges Jan 12 The chief executive of Aetna Inc  on Tuesday said the health insurer is not about to withdraw from the public health exchange market
column5: even after losing money on the business last year.

column3: Jan 13 Not every investor is chagrined by the dismal way the year has started in stocks. Some
column4: like self-described value manager Rupal Bhansali
column5: are gleefully loading up on companies that got beaten down when the whole market sold off at the start of the year.     Bhansali
column6: whose Ariel International Equity Fund  had been socking away cash for just such an occasion
column7: says she is buying in the most battered areas
